pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.2: “Tonics” renders bhesajja. In the origin story below bhesajja seems to refer to the five standard tonics, and I translate it accordingly. The commentary at Sp 2.306 glosses bhesajja with sappitelādīsu, “Ghee, oil, etc.”, which lends some support to this view. In the actual rule, however, the word paccaya is used, which may suggest a broader meaning, and I render it accordingly as “requisites”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.7: According ACMC, p.18, one doṇa is equivalent to 64 handfuls. This is perhaps roughly equivalent to one liter.
